p: The prevalence of H2 subtype AIV is much lower than that of other subtypes such as H5, H7, and H9, [ 6] but H2 influenza viruses are found in wild birds [ 7], swine [ 8], and humans. The Asian pandemic of H2N2 influenza A virus resulted from reassortment of previously circulating human H1N1 and avian H2N2 viruses from 1957 to 1968 [ 8]. In 2006, an H2N3 virus isolated from swine in the United States of America, belonging to the American AIV lineage, shared 84â€“85% similarity with the H2N2 viruses of the 1957 influenza pandemic [ 9, 10]. In wild waterfowl birds, the H2 subtype was mainly identified in mallard ducks in comparison to other subtypes [ 7, 11, 12].
